Reviews.Title: “very bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: sevillaberlin
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my partner for 3 nights, the hotel looks like a cave, the room with no AIR CONDITIONER and the outside temperature almost 40 degrees, Reception offer us a change room, and it was even worse, Breakfast very poor and bad quality.not enough hot water in the room, the bathroom very old without ventilation and last but not least, the decoration is awfull. I do not recomend thís hotel to any one, the reception staff very rude to us´.

Reviews.Title: “Ok”
Reviews.Author: Veggie83
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location as its central and very near a metro station. The reception staff were quite rude and abrupt and we had to press them for details like where our room and the lift were! Room was average and reasonably clean.

Reviews.Title: “good location poor decor”
Reviews.Author: katycrunchie
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my partner during for two nights and mother in law. I used my best western reward points so didn't actually have to pay. However i'm surprised that this hotel is 4* - it really should be 3*. Its very dated and lacks 4* facilities Our rooms were large, clean and next to each other. The hotel is in an excellent location and easy walking distance to all major sites The hotel staff were friendly and helpful. Breakfast was not really what you expect for 4* hotel but was ok. overall a good base to explore madrid but in desperate need for renovation, very 1970s. Tip: Avoid the bars / restaurants on gran via selling overpriced poor quality food, a few streets back are some excellent tapas bars and make sure you speak a little spainish

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel - Great location, though”
Reviews.Author: travelnut2007
Reviews.Content: I'll start off with the positives: The hotel is centrally located. It's very close to many exciting attractions (all within short walks), it's just steps from the Metro, and there are a ton of food options in the area. It's only a few feet away from Gran Via. I wasn't worried about the location at all as there are plenty of people in the area, and a lot of other tourists. Now a few not-so-positives: Others have mentioned that the beds are 'rock hard'. They really are. They were not very comfortable and took some time to get used to before I could actually get some sleep. The building is old and in need of some renovations. It is a "4-star" yet does not seem to have the "4-star" quality typical of 2012. And the negative: When we checked out, we were told that we had not prepaid for the room and needed to pay for the two nights we stayed. I showed the clerk my print out confirmation that showed I had prepaid, but he insisted that we still owed. Then the supervisor/manager/accounting person (I'm not sure of her title) came out - she stated that the rate was not prepaid and that we owed the hotel. I showed her my confirmation and she said that it was still showing on their records that it wasn't paid. Finally, they showed me printed confirmation of the booking at their end - and the name was not ours. In fact, the room number was not even close to our room number. I was quite unimpressed with this. I felt that the front desk person did not verify our hotel room number when we told him, and he just went off my last name (which he misheard). The supervisor/manager/accounting person was defensive and accusatory right off the start. She didn't ask any qualifying questions to ensure that the booking she was looking at was ours. She just assumed it was, which is not of 4-star customer service in my opinion. Had she done things right, she would have said "Let me just verify your room number and name"...especially since I had given BOTH of them my confirmation print out with my full name on it. So, had I not experienced what I considered to be a rude interaction with staff, I would have suggested have given this hotel an "average" rating. Having dealt with this situation, though, and compared to the other 7 hotels we stayed in during our Europe trip, I have to say "poor" for this hotel. I will not be returning the next time I'm in Madrid (And I will return to Madrid as it's a beautiful, friendly, energized city).

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: MrWu
Reviews.Content: As with many hotels, this one is a question of understanding how much you've paid and what that entitles you to. The good: # Fabulous location, 30 metres from Gran Via and 5 minutes walk from the Real Palace, Plaza Mayor etc. # Large, clean room (although 2 twins pushed together rather than the requested double # Large bathroom with twin sinks # Best shower of any hotel anywhere (no, seriously - unlimited hot water and pounding water pressure). # Decent and plentiful breakfast buffet # Free wifi # Did I mention the location? The bad: # No facilities to speak of # Decidedly tired public areas # Thin walls so you can hear everything around you # In bathroom hairdryer like being breathed on by an asthmatic # Bar next door gets beer deliveries at between 3 and 3:30 on Saturday and Tuesday mornings (in my experience) # Wifi code only lasts 24 hours so you have to get it renewed every day. All in all, a perfect budget location for a long weekend. If it's luxury you're after go elsewhere but in my book a 4 night long weekend for 2 at c£400 B&B including flights isn't a bad deal - you could do a great deal worse.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Teymur D
Reviews.Content: Interiors a bit shabby Front desk very helpful (had a difficulty explaining them about lunch basket though - you should say "picnic" :) The shower lever was broken - scalding hot water - but they fixed it quickly enough The nearby stripbar is not really THAT noisy (anyway it sinks in the general nightly noise of Gran Via cars :) 2 min walking to plaza de Espana metro, 10 min walk to Royal Palace

Reviews.Title: “Lots of unfair criticism on here”
Reviews.Author: Leswilson
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just enjoyed a short break in Madrid, where this hotel is ideally positioned as a base from which to explore the city. All the staff are friendly and helpful. Breakfast offers the usual range found in continental Europe and is available from first thing to late morning. The decor is traditional, giving the place a certain charm. Live music in the piano bar makes for a relaxing might cap. All that plus clean, spacious and well equipped rooms means that we will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “An island in the city”
Reviews.Author: ray g
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located within walking distance of many city attractions, and 1 block from Metro so you can easily get anywhere. But what separates it from the other downtown hotels is that it is one block away from the Gran Via, on a quiet side street, which makes it a quiet island within the city. And by European standards the rooms are roomy. It is a Best Western Hotel, but that didn't really mean anything to me, but the staff was very helpful to these non-Spanish speaking (but we did try) Americans, and managed to direct us to many city attractions, including the bus station down the hill where we got a bus to take us to Segovia. When you go to Spain be prepared to change your clock, breakfast around 10, lunch at 3, and tapas at 10 pm.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a city break”
Reviews.Author: pollyanthus
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here in mid-March for 3 nights on an easyjet city break. The hotel was lovely. The staff were very helpful and friendly, our room was clean and attractively decorated. The room was facing the inner courtyard and there was a little noise from the AC units outside, but to be honest, we were so exhausted from wandering around Madrid, we slept like logs! The bathroom was in good condition and clean. The hotel is in a brilliant position to explore the city. The nearest Metro station is Santo Domingo. Breakfast was good, lots of choice. The piano bar was a great place to sit with a drink at the end of the day and the barman was very friendly without being pushy. Reception staff were efficient and helpful. Yes, the hotel is rather elderly, but we felt it added to its' charm and besides, we were out most of the time. A great base and we felt "at home" and welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we wanted xx”
Reviews.Author: theherberts
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a while back and loved it. We were originally booked into a double room but were given a twin by mistake which was quickly rectified without fuss. Breakfast had a very good choice, really set us up for the day. There was a strange smell in the bathroom (not from us I hasten to add) but to be fair we didn't spend too much time in the room to worry about it. Public areas were always very clean and tidy. Staff were friendly and patient with our awful attempts at the language. Yes, it could do with a serious bit of updating as other reviewers photographs show, but our room was very clean and just what we were after. Great location for touring the city and sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location/Reasonable Pricing”
Reviews.Author: brmen
Reviews.Content: I spent four nights at this hotel in October. The location of the hotel, on the Grand Via, was excellent. The continental breakfast was quite good. The food selection was at or above the level of quality I'd expect from a hotel with this star rating. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to stay centrally in a western-style hotel in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Superb service let down by ancient building”
Reviews.Author: KentCouple
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel really can't do enough for you, but at the end of the day, this is an old hotel in an old building, which suffers from not being able to change its basic construction and set-up. We were unsure about using this hotel due to the bad reviews we had seen, but decided to give them a chance. Unfortunately, that most fundamental of needs for a good Hotel, being able to sleep, was simply impossible. The beds are rock-hard - after the first night of hearing "click-click-click" from the ancient heating pipes, then silence for a few minutes, then "click-click-click", along with the heat pouring out of the wall between us and the pipes, we were forced to change rooms in the middle of the night. A much nicer room (both of them seemed to have been renovated fairly recently) and, just when we thought that we could finally get some sleep, a loud drone started as the hotel's Air-Conditioning plant kicked into action in the early morning. We could clearly hear this in spite of being on the top floor - the rooms that we were offered all being internal - maybe the out-facing rooms might be better ? All in all a difficult experience - only a total of 8 hours' sleep in 3 nights - we are due to go to Madrid again soon, but we think that we will go back to our old favourites, the NH Hotels, as at least these seem to be reasonably modern. If you're wondering why we chose this hotel - location (close to the Old Town and Royal Palace) and price (it was the cheapest 4-star hotel we found) unfortunately in Spain it seems that the old adage that "you only get what you pay for" is 100% true !!!

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel i Madrid”
Reviews.Author: lbh3
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights at the hotel in November and generally found it to be fine. It is very close to everything, Gran Via, Palace, Sol etc. Breakfast was good and service at the reception was ok. They’ve got free internet, but I had to pick up a new code every day, a bit complicated. Don’t bring your car to Madrid, but if you do, they got an underground parking lot. A bit pricy, 23 euro a night, but not worse than others in the town. Buy a “go as you please” ticket for bus and metro instead. 14 euro for 3 days, and that will include travel to and from the airport. It is true that the furniture etc. is a bit old fashioned, but that is a part of the hotels “style” and I find it ok. The superior room was big, clean and fine, but the bed was hard as a rock, but what you like is individual. I would prefer it a bit softer. I can recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ray J
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel over the internet. It was great... very clean room, nice bathroom, centrally located, walking distance to the Royal Palace, Cathedral, and we walked to the Prado from there too. The morning breakfast (included in room rate) was great.. nice variety and hot and cold foods. I would very much recommend this hotel. Staff was friendly and easy to understand. We would return to this hotel if we go again to Madrid. Ray J. Murrysville, PA, USA

Reviews.Title: “Poor four (?) stars hotel in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: lcviana
Reviews.Content: My sister-in-law and I stayed at this hotel last September. It was an unpleasant experience. First ,the staff at reception and concierge is not exactly a friendly one: they seemed to be in bad mood all the time and sometimes they were rude. Second, the air conditioner of the two rooms we stayed didn't worked properly and we had to sleep inside an oven because it was 34C in Madrid. Third, the walls are paper thin and we could follow conversations from other rooms. Fourth, breakfast menu was a very basic on: few options of bread; coffee served by a coffee machine that had to be charged from time to time; one or two option of fresh fruit and tinned fruit salad. In sum, we don't recommend this hotel. We are sure there are better and cheaper options in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Not sound proof rooms”
Reviews.Author: Midwifeyk
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice and central, however room we were in adjoined another and was very noisy. Good thing I did not understand their language as they were very loud when ever came back like 330am. Breakfast buffet was fair coffee discusting

Reviews.Title: “Great Location at great prices”
Reviews.Author: Loubyduck
Reviews.Content: A group of 10 of stayed here for 3 night. I found all the staff extremely helpful and friendly. Even pointing us in the right direction for local nightlife and phoning the restaurant we had booked prior to explain we were running late ( our spanish was not so good). The hotel admittedly needs updating in decor stakes however for the £90 perperson we paid for 3 nights this really wasn't a problem. It has a fantastic location ( don't be put off by the lets say adult bar next door but one) and all the sights are in easy walking distance but the underground is about 200m away should you need it. Madrid is a fantastic City and this is definitely a good place to base yourself for the money we paid. I would definitely

Reviews.Title: “Like staying on a very old cruise ship”
Reviews.Author: levd1_10
Reviews.Content: This hotel proudly displays their four-star rating everywhere you go - on the plague at the main entrance, the tissues, the front desk... I wonder how old this rating is, because from the looks of it, it's probably from the 1980's. From the moment you walk into this hotel, it just feels like you are on a very old cruise ship that passed it's prime about 15 years ago. If they are so proud of their four-star rating, why not update the furniture in the rooms (which looks like it's been there for at least 20 years), change the carpet, and pretty up the main lobby? Our first room was overlooking a strip club and a police station. There was always noise on the street, so we asked to be moved, and they switched us to a room facing a wall, which, I guess, is better than a strip club. In the evenings, they have a live piano bar with a great pianist singing Sinatra. Breakfast was ok. Location was ok, too - but there are so many options in Madrid that you could probably find better for the money. The front desk people are friendly and helpful, and they try hard to make sure you have a good stay, but please, Best Western, cough up some money to fix this place up!

Reviews.Title: “Location and basic standard”
Reviews.Author: DavidSzeinuk
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here three times. The hotel offers the basics to enjoy the best he has: the location in the center of Madrid: you can walk to many of the places of interest. The hotel is clean, professional and friendly service. There are rooms more renovated that other, but all of them offer more or less the same. Rates are accord to hotel level. Internet services are not good and very expensive. The piano bar at night is a nice place to have a drink before you go out.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Mayorazgo”
Reviews.Author: ArmyLadyWashingtonDC
Reviews.Content: My adult daughter and I stayed at the Mayorazgo for five nights in April 2011 and felt completed satisfied. We found the hotel to be spotlessly clean, our room was spacious, and everyone who worked there was very nice. We had a Superior Double which had an enclosed balcony, no view but delightfully private, and where we could enjoy a glass of wine together each evening. The hotel is a short walk from two metro stations and is one block off the Gran Via. The large breakfast buffet, included in the room rate, got each day off to a great start. Other reviewers talked about noise from adjoining rooms but we did not experience that at all. We would be happy to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are poor for a 4 star”
Reviews.Author: MarieMM
Reviews.Content: just got back from 3 nights in this hotel. The breakfast is ok --there was enough choice (buffet style as you would expect). The coffee was out of a self service machine and pretty yuk! The staff are quite helpful and the reception area isnt too bad but the settees could do with a clean---they looked a little tired and stained on the arms and seats The big let down was the room. I didnt expect tea and coffee facilites becasue its spain (and there I didnt get them) but the room was dull and tired looking. I had an inside double room so There was no view, just the concrete wall of the inside of the hotel.The air con didnt work and you could hear all the air cons rumbling away for the other rooms and the sound from the bathrooms. Despite being on the inside the room was niosy (air con noise and bathroom nioses from other rooms) The decor was tired and the walls need a coat of paint to freshen them up. The bed spreads were dull and needed replacing but the bedding was clean. Bathroom was ok with the usual little bottles of shampoo etc. Towels were changed every day. You have to pay for the safe 1.40 euros per day (not too bad) All in all I wouldnt give this place more that a 3 star at a push and I wont stay here again. The bar closes at 11pm on sunday --no big deal as there are loads of bars and restaurants around the area. This is part of the Great Western chain so I would personaly avoid this chain in the future ----thank god there is so much going on in Madrid so i only washed and slept in the room. Madrid is a great city We saw some good flamenco in the theatre Munzo in Plasa del Carmen --small theatre and the tickets cost 20 euro (just 5 rows from the front)but there are discount ticket offices right next door so you may get them cheaper if you call in there. I booked mine on line ---great value!!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty bad”
Reviews.Author: Ilovefromagekipue
Reviews.Content: The good: - central location - friendly helpful staff - clean room The bad: - hideous furniture and decor - smelly bathroom - paperthin walls, it's like the guests next door are in your own room - noisy street - uncomfortable bed and pillows ==> unbelievably bad quality for the money The helpful staff at the welcome desk do not make up for the hotel's terrible lack of taste, poor value and overall bad vibe.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: carezia
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, well placed near Gran Via and major commerce streets in central Madrid. It's also very near subway station, so you can easily come and go anyware. Clean bathroom, good breakfast and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “It´s ok and on a very very good place.”
Reviews.Author: MT87
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very good, not the best but ok. There was nothing to complain about, ok breakfest it´s ok. The bathroom was very good, clean and nice. The only thing, it is a "strip" club beside the hotel and we didn´t get any good view from the balkony.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, reasonable priice, but terrible sounproffing”
Reviews.Author: maxim_mos
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in November 2010 for 3 nights. The location is great - just steps from Gran Via. Lot's of bars around - no sence to pay for breakfast at the botel. The hotel has big rooms, they are clean but dated. The worst thing about this hotel is soundproofing - it's really terrible, you can hear everything happening in the next rooms and in the coridor. Try to avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location- Aging Hotel”
Reviews.Author: britgirl26
Reviews.Content: Not a hotel I would choose to stay in again....aging, gaudy decor with slight musty smell throughout the hotel.The water from my shower flowed dark brown the first time it was used.....it ran clear after about 15mins of running the faucet. One of our group was welcomed to her room by a cockroach in the bath! Other members of our group complained of strange smelling/tasting water in their rooms.The public areas were clean and presentable, the breakfast good and the bar area a comfortable place to relax after sightseeing. The Mayorazgo staff are very pleasant and helpful....they did offer to change my room when I mentioned the discolored water. Just seems this hotel has too many unrectified issues to be able to recommend it to fellow travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Just what you need”
Reviews.Author: Sergio303631
Reviews.Content: Location is great, breakfast superb (many options), the piano bar, a charm. Of course the decoration is old-fashioned, but that´s not a problem at all. I was worried due to some negative reviews, but I really enjoyed it. The negative point is the bathroom. The shower is over the bathtub, which is uncomfortable. Anyway, it compensates to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't fault it!”
Reviews.Author: GeorgieB_10
Reviews.Content: As with previous reviewers, my husband and I were slightly anxious about our stay at the Mayorazgo having read several negative comments. We should not have worried. The hotel is in a fantastic location just off the Gran Via and within walking distance of many attractions. The hotel itself is old-fashioned but clean and very comfortable. Our room was spacious, with working air-conditioning, a comfy bed and a good en-suite. There was lots of choice at breakfast and we could have eaten as much as we wanted. Above all, the staff were courteous (from the manager to the barman to the lady who cleaned our room) and couldn't have been more helpful. We would not hestitate to return or to recommend this hotel to friends or family.

Reviews.Title: “A horrible experience”
Reviews.Author: morfytastic
Reviews.Content: When you see a hotel that hasn't changed its decor since 1971, sometimes you can enjoy the kitsch ambience if the place has some redeeming features that will make you warm to it. This hotel has not. It is a spanish Fawlty Towers without the charm. The breakfast menu probably hasn't changed since the seventies either - a basic offering of cold ham, cheese, bread and egg, with tinned fruit salad as the 'healthy' option. I've had better breakfasts in youth hostels! The walls are paper thin, you can clearly follow conversations from next door rooms. The bathrooms have a pungent odourous battle between damp sewers and whatever chemicals they are trying to mask the smell with (even on the 5th floor). The staff were disinterested at best, and confrontational when at their worst. The man at reception threw my room key across the room when i refused to pay for somebody else's room bill. It's no surprise to me that this hotel was empty midweek if it treats its business customers like this. When a hotel like this has claims of being 4-star and yet has 2-star food, staff and rooms, no amount of moldy-grouted marble will cover it up and you end up feeling ripped off.

Reviews.Title: “Run-down hotel”
Reviews.Author: walterfaber
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a good location, but that's about it. Rooms are dirty, the hotel is quite run down, and hotel staff is rude and unhelpful! Don't stay here, except in an emergency!

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd time i have stayed here - 1st time in a triple room which was very good, then a double which was superb and lastly a twin room which was very good - The Breakfast is worth making an effort to get up for - plenty of choices to eat - Location wise is ideal as it's just on the perimeter of the main city centre , 1- minutes from Sol so ideal after a your night out - This time there was a fair bit of noise early in the morning from outside but this may have been my fault as i had the windows open due to the heating being prett effective - i will choose this place next year before anywhere else

Reviews.Title: “Ask for the rooms with roof terrace”
Reviews.Author: AndyHManchester
Reviews.Content: Nice friendly hotel, excellent location a few yards off the Gran Via, but not on it - so the traffic noise is much less. If you can get a top-floor room at the back of the hotel, the rooms have a large roof-terrace perfect for hot Summer nights.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money hotel, with half decent location”
Reviews.Author: Andy_Edit
Reviews.Content: I arrived with 2 male friends on a lads long weekender on 1st May 2009. I was a bit nervous after reading some poor feedback on Trip Advisor, but i think some people miss the point - you get what you pay for. The room didn't have a great view, but we were only there for sleeping. We had a problem with the shower tap falling off but as soon as this was reported to the reception, it was fixed. The curtain did fall down on our first night however (we were not swinging from it!) and i'm not sure our neighbours either side of us would have been too happy at 4am (the walls might be made of cardboard judging by the lack of soundproofing) as 2 semi drunk lads were trying to fix it back up! This also got fixed the next day by the maintenance guys, no problem. Beds were surprisingly comfy, breakfast was served up until 11am - which was a bonus! Concierge guys were very helpful and friendly. Would i take my girlfriend here? Probably not, unless money was an issue, but there were other families there and people seemed happy.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: Jeannemg
Reviews.Content: I was very nervous about this hotel after I read the reviews. It turned out that the hotel was just fine. The rooms may have been small but that is usual in big cities. The room and the bathroom were both clean. The people at the desk in the lobby were helpful. The location is fabulous. We could walk to the Prado and we were surrounded by restaurants and shops. The bar and dining room were comfortable. I'm glad I decided to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the view of the brothel”
Reviews.Author: AustraliaMelbourne
Reviews.Content: I am currently sitting in Room 318. I have logged onto the internet to post my review. The other reviews saying that the staff are unhelpful is correct. My new wife and I dont speak Spanish so we asked the staff to call to confirm a tour. They refused. This is unlike any hotel we have stayed at during our whole trip. I did not mind that the hotel was right in the middle of what appears to be the red light district of Madrid but this place is definately not for families or people who need some assistance with communication with locals. Also the breakfast is poor. We usually have some cerial and juice and just leave.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, shame about the bedrooms!”
Reviews.Author: foxterrier2
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location is excellent - a few yards off Gran Via. The reception area and bar are very nice. Breakfast room decor was very average. The cooked part of the breakfast - bacon, fried eggs and scrambled eggs - was unapettising and dreadfully presented. The cold buffet was pretty basic - expected better for what is a 4* hotel. The real let down however is the bedrooms - although quite a good size they are drab, tired, very dated and in urgent need of complete refurbishment. The bathrooms are similarly in need of complete updating.

Reviews.Title: “Doh! Why did I use a travel agent???!”
Reviews.Author: Last-minit-Traveler
Reviews.Content: My first mistake was booking this hotel through the Marsans travel agent instead of just going on line as I had been doing my whole trip. The hotel seemed appropriate from the pictures, kind of a midieval theme with knights and armor, fitting considering I just came from Toledo. The staff at the front desk was neither friendly nor rude, just sort of indifferent. Definitely not helpful at all. Since I fly by the seat of my pants it was important for me to have internet, when I asked about the internet he told me 6 euro per hour 12 euro per day. Later in my room after getting ready for bed, I find out I need to go downstairs to the front desk to buy my internet from them! (Would have liked to have known that earlier while I was standing right there in front of him!) When I did finally get on line, I was constantly loosing my wifi signal, sometimes the search for wifi turned up no signals whatsoever and then other times there was a telefonica signal which was a completely different server (requiring it's own fee!) The TV remote worked about as often as the internet, after buying the extra movie channels for 11 Euro, the channel would switch off about every 5 minutes. Calls to the front desk were not helpful and met with the same indifferent attitude as check-in. Laundry was unbelievably expensive and thankfully closed on the weekend (Traveling with two young children I was almost desperate enough to pay) of course the front desk offered no help to finding the locations of nearby wash-a-terias. (There was one on Calle del Cruz near Del Sol) Parking was right across the street but expensive at 25 Euro a day, and no validations from hotel either. Not that it's not done in Spain because NH Viapol validated my parking in Sevilla. Breakfast was lame, not a big selection, especially if you arrived after 9:30 where most of all the fresh fruit and sliced hamon was already gone. The hotel room walls were paper thin so sleeping in is not a problem if you have noisy neighbors. The attendant and busboy were friendly though. The only good thing was the location which was excellent, a short walk to the Prado, Del Sol, and immediately near the metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: CRANGI
Reviews.Content: Staff were pleasant and helpful. Hotel was clean and comfortable. Just off Gran Via and very close to the metro line and therefore easily accessible from the airport. Cost for one metro journey was two euros, which included airport supplement. The breakfast catered for all tastes and was buffet style, with continental and cooked breakfasts available, and served from 7.30-11.00am. The room was clean with bath and overbath shower. Plenty of hot water available, together with shower gels, etc. Bedding clean and towels changed daily. No tea/coffee making facilities in the rooms though. Overall, a pleasant stay and good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, old style hotel”
Reviews.Author: miamistyle99
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent an interesting 36 hours in Madrid at the end of April 08. Our travel agent recommended the Mayorazgo as a reasonably priced hotel in the centre of Madrid so we decided to go there. The hotel staff were all very pleasant; the room was 'old style' by which I mean that it could easily have come out of the 1950's. We found Madrid to be boring (why do all the guide books say to go to Toledo for the 2nd day of a trip to Madrid?!?) so we did spend a large amount of time in the hotel room. If you want a base to tour Madrid then the Mayorazgo is for you. I am sure other hotels will have 'specials' for cheaper rates, and I suggest going to El Corte Inglese to buy the ingredients for a breakfast instead of the overpriced low selection they serve here. Overall a big plus for the staff, a mediocre on the rooms and hotel and a minus for the breakfast - an adequate stay in a city we’re not rushing back to any time soon.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough”
Reviews.Author: Peter123452
Reviews.Content: First of all, hotel's location is excellent: roght off the Gran Via and next to Plaza De espanya (10 minutes to Puerta Del Sol by foot). Room was large and clean - not sterile, but clean. Room was quite old and shabby, and was poorly lit. Bathroom was very big and clean, and also, very old. Staff was pleasant and polite during our entire stay. Breakfast is good with a good selection. all in all, not too pricey and well located hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby ! should be renewed !”
Reviews.Author: Naish
Reviews.Content: Old is an understatement It's just shabby and not fit for staying any more Just one look on the huge antique room key and I knew what was expecting to me in the room... We received bed sheeets with spirm stains !!! (look at the pictures) The carpet was smelly The room gave us a very bad feeling and we could not stay. They refuse to give us refund for the first night (we ordered 3 night). Even though we could not stay even for one night. We went across the street to Senator hotel payed 40 euros more and got a very nice room To conclude - unless they did a major(!) renovation since 2005 - don't go !

Reviews.Title: “Ye Olde Decor of Mayorazgo - But Good Location”
Reviews.Author: MaryK7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as part of an organised tour of Spain. The first thing that struck me was the decor - "medieval knights of olde" pretty much sums up some of the decor (pretend lead lighting of windows, room doors with studded leather, medieval lamps, suits of armor, etc). In terms of comfort, the rooms were very comfortable and fairly spacious. Linen was clean, bathroom was older but very clean, good TV. It is probably in need of refurbishment but I've certainly stayed in worse. Our main two concerns 1) paper thin walls meant we could hear whatever our neighbours were up to (getting busy! - just turn up the TV) and 2) the bathroom window opened into - their bathroom window! That was amusing! Breakfast downstairs had a good selection of pastries, tea, coffee, cereals, cold meats, bread and yoghurt. As we were on a tour, it is possible the buffet was less impressive than if we were paying customers. Location was good, just off the Grand Via, and there are a few cafes and restaurants nearby, plus the theatre district on your doorstep. The Il Corte Ingles department store is also a short walk away and really does have everything. Overall, not a bad hotel. The customer service was helpful and friendly and they didn't mind speaking English.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but old fashioned........”
Reviews.Author: mikeyb0y
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a group of 13 for my Stag do. Booked directly through a friend who works at a travel agents so got a good discount. First impressions were good as the lobby was clean and tidy and the staff dealt with us quickly. They obviously catered for us especially by putting us all on the ground floor. I guess they thought we would be noisy and rowdy when we returned in the early hours.... The rooms, like the rest of the hotel come across as very dated. Most of our rooms were triple's and the third bed was a camp bed which had seen better days. Being on the ground floor we had no view, which was not a problem as we were hardly in the rooms anyway. We had to request keys for the safe which reception provided and i also had to request bath towels for the 3rd person. A strange thing was the air con in the bathroom, which turned out to be a void which runs up the inside of the building. When you open the glass panel which hides the void, you can pretty much hear everything in nearby rooms. Overall we were treated well by the staff. We would all meet in the bar in the evening and were served quickly and given cold meats and nibbles to chew which was a nice touch. We were never really noisy or rowdy as we didnt end up staggering back until 7am! Of course, the great thing about the hotel is the location. In walking distance of all the good bars! Would recommend to people going for a party weekend or wanting to be close to the centre.

Reviews.Title: “Ok location and Ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: Usham
Reviews.Content: Location: The hotel is located right next to plaza espana station and is just off the Gran Via. The Royal Palace is immediatly behind the hotel about a 5-10 min walk away . There are a few cafe's and restaurants nearby. We found that the hotel was not as central as we first thought, the night life seemed to be around plaza mayor and santa ana which was a 10-15 min walk away from the hotel, apart from that we couldn't really fault the location. Rooms: Were clean, comfy and quite spacious and included a small table and chairs. It was nicely decorated in warm colours and there was ample wardrobe space. The bathroom was spacious and clean too. It would be useful to have tea/coffee making facilities in the room as this is currently not provided.This was a good average 4* hotel. There are a lot of hotels in Madrid particularly in this area but I would recommend the Mayorazgo to anyone who doesn't mind walking a little to places in the evening. Breakfast: Was ok, nothing special. Continental and hot buffet, though I agree with a previous review that the scrambled eggs were not great. If you arrive too late then there may not be anything left as they don't leave a lot of the hot buffet stuff out. Piano Bar/Smoking room: The hotel only allows you to smoke in designated areas and the piano bar is one of them. It's a pleasant bar and the staff are very friendly and helpful here. Customer service: Didn't really have a problem here, they were very accommodating throughout our stay especially about checking us in & out and providing info about tours. We did come across someone that wasn't very helpful when we tried to book the airport shuttle back but everyone else was pleasant. We discovered that for a euro you can get to and from the airport on the metro which is really easy from plaza espana rather than pay 25-40 euros for a taxi or even 11 euros for the shuttle. This is your average four star hotel there is nothing really terrible or good about it. You could stay in worse!

Reviews.Title: “Good location is the only good thing”
Reviews.Author: zulka_58
Reviews.Content: Good location is the only good thing there.We had to change rooms beacuse at first we were in a low floor ,and the "sight" from the window was pipes and back stairs.The other room (we had 2 rooms) was the same plus terrible odour.After changing rooms it was OK.The stuff at the concierge gave us wrong information about trains to Toledo....so we spent ,or waste an hour and a half at the station. When we left to the airport they refer us to the street for a taxi,as they said they ussually don't call for taxis.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Enough but only one complaint!”
Reviews.Author: ashbash69
Reviews.Content: We went to Madrid as a group of 9 people on a hen weekend. The hotel itself was great but the only thing that we found fault in was the bar service. It was very slow with only one bar staff member on and it was a friday night.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; very old hotel”
Reviews.Author: RISG
Reviews.Content: All there is to say about this hotel is that it has a great location. It is a few meters from Gran Via. Social areas look nice, with a huge place for breakfast. Breakfast was excellent with a lot of variety. Now, the only problem is the room we were given (a triple) looked like it had not been touched for 20 years. The doors, the bathroom, all was old, very old, and not well maintained. I understand that some rooms have been remodeled, but it was not our case.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Firesong
Reviews.Content: A good location just off the Gran Via close to the palace and not to far away from the prada; however the bedrooms seem to back onto the next rooms bathrooms and can be quite noisy. The bathroom was good with a nice shower. The room was clean but a bit dark, The cleaners were eager to clean the rooms which after a good night out wasn't welcome. I liked the piano bar; it had a good atmosphere, The breakfast was ok but nothing special. Madrid was great although rather cold when we were there, Watch out for handbag thieves. I saw a man trying to steal a mans briefcase in the starbucks on the gran via. Enjoyed Madrid and would go again in the summer but not to the Mayorgazgo.

Reviews.Title: “whats the fuss?”
Reviews.Author: shellyshoo
Reviews.Content: I have read some of the reviews after booking this hotel and was initially worried.It was a cheap long weekend so we thought we would take a chance with an open mind.The hotel is in a great location when you find it ! It is spotlessly clean.Our room was spacious and clean,the plasma tv was a nice touch.You have to remember that this is an old hotel, it has many nice traditional features.We had a great weekend, even though it never stopped raining !Madrid is a great city, loads to see and do and reasonable too.I would reccommend this hotel, if you don't like it there is something wrong with you.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for Gran Via shopping & theatres”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveller5000
Reviews.Content: Loved our stay here.The hotel was close to 2 metro stations, the old quarter, Gran Via shopping & theatres, the Royal palace & gardens. Great choice of restaurants abound nearby. Its a bit hard to find just off the main street but after the first time its easy to find your way back to;The telephone staff seem to have limited English, so a web booking was the way to go & once there a cab was the easiest way to find their street, Flor Baja which doesn't seem to appear on any tourist map (for the benefit of future visitors...its a very narrow street off the Gran Via just beyond the Teatro Lope de Vega). Great base for old quarter & Madrid's answer to the "west-end".

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - already planning to return”
Reviews.Author: Jude C
Reviews.Content: Given the negative comments posted on TripAdvisor I was worried at the thought of staying 3 nights at the Mayorazgo. When we booked in, we had a voucher which was accepted immediately and my passport was only checked for one minute then handed back. We asked for a quiet room and were instantly changed from our allocated one on the 1st floor to one on the 5th floor at the end of the corridor which was very quiet. The view was not great - an internal courtyard, but we wouldn't have wanted to look out on Grand Via with the noise and pollution anyway. The bathroom was great - bath, shower and bidet and lots of hot water. Beds, and a little sitting area with arm chairs and coffee table plus the flat screen TV made it all very pleasant. Yes, it was a little tired - metal frame windows for example but that had no impact on our enjoyment. The buffet breakfast was excellent and plentiful - the breakfast room was packed with people who clearly thought the same and the waiting staff were rushed off their feet clearing tables. Reception was helpful and unobtrusive - we don't like being overwhelmed and would rather carry our own bags. When we wanted to use the Internet it was organised immediately. On our last day we left the luggage for the day before the flight and were asked if we wanted a taxi booked. Location was excellent - right on top of Plaza Espana metro which is very convenient from the airport and all of old Madrid was completely walkable. Like any big city Madrid had its share of street homeless and drinkers but as one of 2 women I did not feel in danger walking around past midnight because the streets are so full of people. Top tip: the new Terminal 4 is lovely but it takes a long time to travel to and from it - particularly if you are flying to/from T4S (as British Airways does) - give yourselves plenty of time if using the Metro to get there as you have to use a free bus and another little train as well.

Reviews.Title: “Best thing was Location”
Reviews.Author: steph01970
Reviews.Content: I had read the reviews of the hotel after we booked it through a travel agent. I was kind of apprehensive myself (as others have posted). The check in was fine when we got there- we were expecting to have to put our luggage behind the desk as we got there straight from the airport at about 12:30pm local time and knew check in was not until 3pm. They had a room ready for us. It overlooked the inner "courtyard" that I think someone else mentioned- not a great view but I was glad it didn't overlook the adult club next door or face a street for any street noise. The people in the room next to us liked to talk on the phone/to each other loudly- so that was semi annoying- but really only when we were trying to go to sleep. We didnt spend much other time in the room other then sleep. I didn't like the shower- with the water coming from the middle instead of the end like I am used to in the US........we got a double bed non smoking room as requested so I can't complain about that. The service of the staff was ok. We also had the issue of getting a cab- the numerous concierges and doorman on duty told us to go to the street and wouldn't hail or call one for us. The breakfast was alright- a pretty good selection of foods but the eggs were greasy (fried) or watery (Scrambled) so they were disappointing. The one thing I loved about the hotel was the location to alot of Madrid- close to metro stops on various lines and good walking distance to theatre and restaurants and all.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend the Mayorazgo”
Reviews.Author: a0075cg
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Mayorazgo for 2 nights prior to my wedding in Madrid. After reading other revews on trip advisor I was a little apprehensive, but went ahead with my stay because my sister had paid to stay there. The room I was given had a terrible smell, which came from the bathroom, within which was a small window which opened onto a system of pipes. I did not have time to change the room because I had allot on my mind with regards to wedding preperation. My sister had already changed rooms 3 times, so I suspected that the next room would not be much better. The room overlooked the back of an awful courtyard, and other hotel rooms which paid more than a passing resemblance to council flats. The service in the hotel was also poor, for example, when I asked if they could call me a taxi, they referred me to the street to call one for myself. The breakfast was fine, but the breakfast room reminded me of faulty towers in terms of its decor. Overall, I feel that the hotel's 4 star rating, and the prices they charge are scandellous, given the quality of accomodation and service offered.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel at all costs....”
Reviews.Author: LaSangria
Reviews.Content: Having travelled extensively through Spain several times, I found this to be the worst hotel in the entire country. SERVICE - Extremely poor. I speak Spanish fairly well. Despite this, I found the front desk and hotel manager to be rude and prejudiced upon check in. In total, I stayed almost a week at this hotel, on different dates, since Madrid served as my central travel point for various destinations (Andalucia, Ibiza, etc.) On numerous occasions, they never helped assist with the luggage, though I had asked for help repeatedly in Spanish (single female). In addition, they gave me the third degree regarding a travel voucher despite the fact that I had a booking at the hotel under the travel agency (tour operator), and held my passport for an unusually long period of time. They were equally unhelpful with directions and recommendations for restaurants in the area. I also asked them on several occasions when the tour operator Trapsatur was going to begin the city tour of Madrid, and they failed miserably at this task, and refused to call the operator, even though they were right next door to Trapsatur, I missed the tour altogether. They were equally unhelpful with arranging or notifying me of my other airport transfers. As a result, I found myself hating Madrid because of this hotel. It is improperly rated as a 4 star hotel. ROOM DECOR - Dirty and outdated, very old furniture; bathroom not functioning well (shower/toilet), the room view consisted of looking at the other neighboring building's grimy walls, and the police station across the street. The bed was old and saggy and even their quietest room was noisy (sirens and traffic at night). NEIGHBORHOOD - Very shady, next to a strip club. Although it's walking distance to a metro station, the hotel is noisy because it's off the Gran Via (a major street in Madrid), but this area seemed to have many shady characters, homeless people, drug addicts, etc. especially at night. Even during the day, I didn't feel safe as a female solo traveler. OVERPRICED - At over 110 euros a night, this does not provide good value, considering the quality and service of the hotel and its surrounding neighborhood. BREAKFAST BUFFET: very mediocre, and not worth mentioning. CONCLUSION - In the end, I was so fed up with the lousy service, quality and location of this hotel, that I ended up hopping on the express train to Cordoba, and staying overnight at Hotel Occidental Cordoba ( a fine hotel), even though I still had an additional 2 nights booked in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Not a four star hotel”
Reviews.Author: M&Ben
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Mayorazgo Hotel in June. I was very disappointed by the hotel, we had just come from a beautiful hotel in El Peurto Santa Maria (Hotel Monasterio San Miguel) which was also a four star. There was no comparision between the two. Hotel Monasterio was palacial in comparision and deserved its four star status and more. The hotel Mayorazgo appeared rather shabby and could have done with a good clean. The furniture in the hallway was quite shabby, the upholstery was filthy. Breafast was awful, the cornflakes were soggy and there was tinned fruit, very 70s. I sure this must have been a lovely hotel in its day but it needs to be re-furbished or the grading of the hotel reduced. It does not deserve the four star status. We were lucky that we had a back room and it was nice and quiet but I can imagine if you are other parts of the hotel it may be noisy as the walls are very thin. On the plus side the hotel is very central not far from either metro station Crowne Plaza on Plaza Espana and Santo Domingo on Grand Via. The transport system in Madrid is excellent and it is relatively easy to get around, though we got lost a few times when we were walking around. We travelled from Seville to Madrid by the fast train service is was excellent. This hotel is ok is you are not looking for any frills and it is just a bed to sleep in. There was a nice flat screen tv. There was a topless bar next door but it didn't seem to cause much problems. I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with Great Location”
Reviews.Author: VoyageurMontreal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mayorazgo for 3 nights in June. The location is excellent as you can walk everywhere and save a bit on cab fares. The downside is that it was somewhat noisy at times, mostly from outside as our room was on the third floor. The football scores had a role to play in the commotion...The Hotel had an old traditional feel and charm and was well maintained and clean. Our room was somewhat small and my husband and I thought that the bed would be at least a queen size, since that is what we are used to at other 4 star hotels in Spain. The air conditioning was not in working order, despite our 2 requests to have it looked at. I believe it was repaired on the third night. The breakfast was great: American (after 8 am) and Continental. The breafast was available until 11 am, which was also well appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Top Gaff the Mayorazga”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Hotel for four nights late March. Hotel lobby was opulent and almost grandiose. Rooms were had period decor, but clean and spacious. Breakfast was excellent, good range, fresh food. Reception, breakfast and bar staff friendly and helpful. Hotel location, perfect, easy walk to anywhere (aside from maybe the Bernabeu stadium) Excellent Value-For-Money and good service.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, poor decor in the rooms”
Reviews.Author: Sceptre
Reviews.Content: The room was very old and shabby feeling, but it was fairly clean. The breakfast was very good, though. Good location.

Reviews.Title: “Mayorazgo”
Reviews.Author: agent69
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend break to the Hotel Mayorazgo.Having read the other reviews we were a bit concerned regarding the noise issues. Yes,the bedroom walls are thin,thought our neighbours were using our bathroom at one point! There was also a group of high-spirited football fans singing at 3am outside the hotel one night also,possibly on their way to the strip club that is situated 3 doors away from the hotel! The rooms are quite dated and dark,(green faux-leather padding on the wardrobe doors)and our room had no air-con ,which was fine in April,but would make the room stifling in summer months.I must also add that the rooms were spotlessly clean,but overall probably not worthy of a 4* rating. Breakfast was good,plenty of choice.The reception staff were very helpful.The bar and reception areas are comfortable,again the decor could best be described as "busy". Overall this hotel is in a great location for shopping,sightseeing and restaurants.This was our first time in Madrid but we would definitely return to this hotel just for the location and value for money that it offered.
